IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR MUSEUM IS TO BE THE PREEMINENT CENTER FOR THE EXPLORATION OF THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR AND ITS LEGACIES FROM MULTIPLE PERSPECTIVES: UNION AND CONFEDERATE,ENSLAVED AND FREE AFRICAN AMERICANS, SOLDIERS AND CIVILIANS
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR MUSEUM IS TO BE THE PREEMINENT CENTER FOR THE EXPLORATION OF THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR AND ITS LEGACIES FROM MULTIPLE PERSPECTIVES: UNION AND CONFEDERATE, ENSLAVED AND FREE AFRICAN AMERICANS, SOLDIERS AND CIVILIANS.
IRS990.Desc: THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR MUSEUM (ACWM) WAS CREATED IN 2013, BRINGING TOGETHER THE MUSEUM OF THE CONFEDERACY (MOC) AND THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR CENTER AT HISTORIC TREDEGAR (ACWC). A NEW 501(C)3 WAS FORMED TO OPERATE THE ENTERPRISE WHILE PRESERVING ASSETS OF THE PREDECESSOR INSTITUTIONS AS SUBSIDIARIES OF THE NEW MUSEUM. THE MOC'S WORLD-CLASS ARTIFACT AND ARCHIVAL COLLECTION REMAINS WITHIN ITS CONFEDERATE MEMORIAL LITERARY SOCIETY AUSPICES. THE ACWC RETAINS ITS COLLECTIONS AND LICENSE AGREEMENTS. ALL ASSETS ARE USED TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR MUSEUM. THE ACWM OPERATES THREE LOCATIONS: THE MUSEUM AND WHITE HOUSE OF THE CONFEDERACY, HISTORIC TREDEGAR AND MUSEUM OF THE CONFEDERACY - APPOMATTOX.WE SERVED APPROXIMATELY 86,700 PAID VISITORS AND SERVED AN ADDITIONAL 200,000 PEOPLE THROUGH SPECIAL EVENTS AND FREE PROGRAMS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: IN ADDITION TO ITS EXHIBITS PROGRAM, THE MUSEUM OFFERS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT FURTHER ITS MISSION. YEAR-ROUND TOURS ARE OFFERED TO SCHOOL, YOUTH AND ADULT VISITORS AT EACH OF ITS THREE LOCATIONS. THE MUSEUM OFFERS LECTURES, BOOK SIGNINGS, COMMUNITY-WIDE SPECIAL EVENTS, LIVING HISTORY, LIVE THEATER AND OTHER PERFORMING ARTS, SYMPOSIA AND TEACHER WORKSHOPS. COMMUNITY OUTREACH INCLUDES PROVIDING PERSONNEL FOR LECTURES AND PRESENTATIONS RELATED TO THE PERIOD FOR A VARIETY OF OFF-SITE PROGRAMS. THE MUSEUM ALSO PUBLISHES A QUARTERLY MAGAZINE THAT SHOWCASES ITS IMPRESSIVE AND UNSURPASSED COLLECTION; NEW SCHOLARSHIP; INITIATIVES AND PROGRAMS TO BETTER ENGAGE ITS MEMBERSHIP, DONORS AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE MUSEUM MANAGES THE PROPERTY AND HAS AN OPERATING AGREEMENT WITH THE RICHMOND NATIONAL BATTLEFIELD PARK OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS). THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, NPS OPERATES ITS CENTRAL VISITORS CENTER TO ALL ITS REGIONAL BATTLEFIELD LOCATIONS AND MUSEUM EXHIBITS. THE CENTER AND NPS PARTNER PUT ON A NUMBER OF EDUCATIONAL, PUBLIC AND MARKETING INITIATIVES AND JOINTLY OPERATE THE CIVIL WAR GATEWAY VISITORS CENTER.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: OBLIGATION UNDER CAPITAL LEASE, CURRENT PORTION
OBLIGATION UNDER CAPITAL LEASE, NONCURRENT PORTION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MUSEUM DOES NOT CAPITALIZE DONATED COLLECTIONS OF MUSEUM ARTIFACTS AND EXHIBITS. NO SIGNIFICANT COLLECTION ITEMS WERE DONATED TO THE MUSEUM IN THE CURRENT YEAR.

THE MUSEUM COLLECTS AND PRESERVES SELECT OBJECTS, RECORDS AND HISTORICAL EFFECTS THAT SUPPORT ITS MISSION TO BE THE PREEMINENT CENTER FOR THE EXPLORATION OF THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR AND ITS LEGACIES FROM MULTIPLE PERSPECTIVES: UNION AND CONFEDERATE, ENSLAVED AND FREE AFRICAN AMERICANS, SOLDIERS, AND CIVILIANS. THE MUSEUM MAINTAINS TWO TYPES OF COLLECTIONS, PERMANENT AND TEACHING. THESE COLLECTIONS SUPPORT EXHIBITS AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THE PERMANENT COLLECTION REPRESENTS MATERIAL OF THE GREATEST HISTORICAL SIGNIFICANCE AND THEREFORE IT RECEIVES THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF CARE. AMONG THE ICONIC PIECES WITHIN THE COLLECTION ARE SIXTEEN OF SEVENTEEN FULL UNIFORMS, FIELD GEAR AND PERSONAL EFFECTS OF CONFEDERATE GENERALS-INCLUDING THOSE OF ROBERT E. LEE, J.E.B. STUART AND THOMAS J. 'STONEWALL' JACKSON. THE COLLECTION ALSO HOLDS OVER 500 BATTLE FLAGS OF THE CONFEDERACY AS WELL AS FEDERAL FLAGS. THE MUSEUM IS ALSO FORTUNATE TO HAVE A NUMBER OF ITEMS RELATED TO VARIOUS UNITS OF THE UNITED STATES COLORED TROOPS AS WELL AS MATERIALS RELATED TO THE ABOLITIONIST MOVEMENT, WOMEN, CHILDREN AND IMMIGRANT COMMUNITIES.
EARNINGS FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO INCREASE THE PRINCIPAL VALUE OF THE FUNDS AND TO ADVANCE THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MONUMENT GROUP WAS HIRED TO ASSIST WITH STRATEGIC FUNDRAISING FOR THE ORGANIZAITON. THERE WERE NO FUNDRAISING EVENTS HELD TO RAISE FUNDS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: BOARD MEMBER IS A SHAREHOLDER OF NEW MARKET CORPORATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THIS FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE MANAGEMENT TEAM AND THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND REPORTED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE THE 990 IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MONITORS THIS POLICY THROUGH THE EXECUTIVE, AUDIT AND NOMINATIONS COMMITTEES. THE POLICY IS MONITORED AT THE STAFF LEVEL THROUGH THE DIRECTOR LEVEL. IF ANY IMPLICATIONS ARISE THAT A CONFLICT MAY BE PRESENT IT IS ADDRESSED ACCORDING TO POLICY. PRIMARILY, THE FIRST STEP IS THROUGH DISCLOSURE OF RELATIONSHIPS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD REVIEWS THE MUSEUMS'S BUDGET, THE SKILLS OF THE APPLICANT, STRATEGIC NEEDS AND PREVIOUS SALARY HISTORY TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION LEVEL OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR DETERMINES THE SALARIES OF THE DEPARTMENT HEADS BASED ON ANNUAL SURVEY RESULTS OF VA ASSOCIATION OF MUSEUMS AND THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MUSEUMS AS WELL AS SALARY HISTORY AND STRATEGIC NEEDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MUSEUMS'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
DONATED SERVICES AND USE OF FACILITIES -1,165,200.
